bio: Journalist, artist, photographer for National Geographic Magazine. Most recently founder of the Ancient Art Archive @ancientartarchive

list.comment: The Moai of Rapa Nui (Easter Island) are some of the most iconic statues in the world. They are huge and enigmatic. The heaviest of the erected statues weigh an astonishing 86 tonnes. 900 of the statues were erected on an island barely 15 miles long. By the time of European contact all 900 statues had been toppled in some social upheaval. I look at the statues as the art work that punctuates one of the greatest feats of exploration human have ever accomplished. Rapa Nui is amazingly remote. There are no other inhabited islands for nearly 2,000 miles in any direction. Sometime around 900 CE the founders of Rapa Nui set out from their home islands in Polynesia in open decked sailing canoes. They not only found this incredibly remote land but then guided only by the stars and their knowledge of the ocean returned to their homeland, packed up all that they would need to begin a new existence in a place thousands of miles away and set out to find Rapa Nui once again. It was an amazing act of human accomplishment. #respect #rapanui shot on assignment for @natgeoexpeditions

Ominous late afternoon light falls on the Potala Palace in Lhasa, Tibet. It also illuminates the roof tops of the very modern city of Lhasa. The amount of development in Tibet since the completion of the Qinghai-Tibet railway is amazing. Tremendous numbers immigrants are moving to this once remote province and ethnic Tibetans will soon be a minority. #Tibet

A rock dove flies through a vaulted entrance of the mosque at the Taj Mahal in Agra. The Taj Mahal itself is a mausoleum but it is flanked by a mosque and a mirror building that balances out the architectural composition. @natgeoimagecollection #india

Congrats to my friend @pedromcbride on his new book! Check out the link in his profile for more. Huge Respect! 750 miles, 13 months, eight pairs of shoes, two friends and one camera to document our iconic national park – the Grand Canyon. The story of this transect through the length of the only canyon visible from outer space is now available in the pages of a new book: The Grand Canyon; Between River and Rim. I am thrilled to see this come to life in time for the park’s 100thbirthday next year. See rare vantages of this roofless cathedral but also learn how it’s at risk to change. Portions of the proceeds support the Grand Canyon Association, which helps protect the park.Thanks to @Rizzolibooks #hamptonsides #kevinfedarko for helping see this marathon reach bookstores near you. To learn more or find where to pick up a copy check out the bio link @pedromcbride. #grandcanyon #betweeenriverandrim #petemcbride

Hand Prints Bears Ears National Monument, Utah | photo by @salvarezphoto If there was a single symbol for all humanity it might well be the negative hand print. I've seen hand prints on 6 continents and across all ages of human history. That urge to record our passing in a permanent way, to make art, is innately human. That urge inspired me to create the nonprofit @ancientartarchive. In the time before written language -most of human history- our stories were recorded on rock and cave walls around the planet. We are in a race to preserve humanity's oldest stories before they disappear to climate change, population pressure and mismanagement. This #givingtuesday follow the link in @ancientartarchive bio to join and help us preserve humanity's oldest stories.

Chomolungma rises like a giant pyramid of stone among the high peaks of Himalayas. Known in the west as Mt Everest, it is the undisputed tallest mountain in the world. The official height is 29,029 feet but it continually gains height as the Indian land mass collides with Eurasia. I shot this image from an airplane window on yesterday's flight from Lhasa to Kathmandu. Always pick a window seat flying over the Himalayas! #Chomolungma #everest #aerial

After a long day of carrying tourists, a Bedouin man leads his camels past Al-Khazneh (The Treasury) in the Nabatean city of Petra. Built in the first century AD a mausoleum it is the most famous of Petra’s carved facades. In the 1st century Petra was a prosperous city of 20,000 built in part on the lucrative trade in frankincense. The engineering that went into Petra is astounding. Not only were huge tombs like this carved from solid rock but water was diverted for miles along covered aqueducts to water the city. On assignment for @natgeoexpeditions #petra #jordan

I have watched grown men reduced to tears by its grandeur. The Taj Mahal is the most beautiful building I have ever seen. Photographs can't even begin to express its perfection. Commissioned as a mausoleum in 1632 by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan to house the remains of his favorite wife, the Taj Mahal is set in a 42 acre complex of gardens and buildings on the Yamuna River. It is the "jewel of Muslim art in India." Shot on assignment for @natgeoexpeditions
The Monastery in Petra, Jordan. The Treasury is the more famous building but for my taste the Monastery is more impressive. #petra #jordan @natgeoexpeditions

Pre-dawn sky in Apia Samoa. This early jet lagged morning I walked out of my hotel room in Apia to the most wonderful night sky. We often talk about jet lag like its a bad thing but it often opens up parts of the day that we'd otherwise be occupying with sleep. #travel #Samoa

It looks kind of like a fight but this is the debating courtyard at the Sera Monastery in Lhasa Tibet. Monks gather for two hours a day to discuss the finer points of Tibetan Buddhist philosophy. Correct answers are met with a hand clamp, wrong ones are met with humor and teasing. #Lhasa

A Samoan fire dancers concludes a show in Apai, Samoa. The fire dance traces its roots back to a Polynesian warrior dance seen in different forms across the Pacific Islands. Fire is a relatively late addition to the traditional demonstration of a warriors strength and skill. The speed and precision that the dancers move with their burning torches is impressive as is the dedication that goes into producing the dance.

Shot on assignment for @natgeoexpeditions #Samoa #Firedance
